Titre: Internship January 2020 - Business Analyst Luxury Division
Descriptif_du_poste:
First things first:
Where will you work? Paris Area (Levallois-Perret or Clichy)
When will you start? In January
How long will it last? 6 months
How much will you earn? Between 1250 - 1550€/month
L'Oréal, yes but do you really know us?
Yes, we know that you think you know L’Oréal - you might even think of red lipstick and high-heels. Well, for those of you who did, let us tell you one thing: that’s not who we are and that’s not what we are looking for. Truth be told more than 40% of our French work force is masculine (and most of us are wearing sneakers by the way)! What you do need is a passion for people, pace and a visionary mindset on how to disrupt the #future!
Now, let’s talk numbers :
Our turnover: 26,9 Billion Euros of consolidated turnover
Our reach: we are present in 150 countries
Our strength: 86,000 passionate employees and 36 international brands
Our commitment: Global environment leader with triple A score in climate change, water security and forests (given by the CDP)
You thought that it is not possible to be an entrepreneur in a big group? Well, let us prove you otherwise!
Our 36 International brands are looking for courageous minds, challenging innovators and strategic out-of the-box thinkers.

Discover Business Analysis at L'Oréal

Our international brands perform in our markets all over the world and their success and growth varies across different market realities. Our marketing teams need reliable and synthetic information about brand performance in different zones and useful market insights in order to take winning bets and push the boundaries everywhere.
We are looking for curious analysts who know how to make data talk and how to analyse markets in order to identify growth potential.

So what does your job look like?

Reporting to a Marketing Director at zone level, with the support of a strong integration program, your responsibilities may include, but are not limited to the following:

Market analysis: monthly follow up of Europe target market
Brand results analysis: monthly reporting of the Brand, pillars & innovation performance, across our European countries, online & offline
Contribution on the preparation of the internal meetings with top management and countries
Strategic research on targeted topics (competitors' strategies / market categories / trends / distribution...)

You are...

A Master student (Cesure or Fin d’études) - No marge of negotiation on this one! Able to provide an internship agreement of 6 months issued by your school - no negotiation either!
Creative Entrepreneur: courageous and adventurous. Every single day, you spot opportunities to shake things up and change the world for the better. There’s no blueprint for the future. You’ll have to design it yourself!
People oriented. You’re not afraid of new ways of doing things or of other people’s (sometimes crazy) ideas. Here, we cherish and celebrate diversity so you’ll feel right at home whoever you are.
Respectful. Whether you’re talking to our CEO (this can happen! ) or a fellow intern, you treat everyone the same.
Willingness to own the strategic level direction whilst maintaining a passion for grass-roots
Critical thinking with strong decision-making abilities
Confidence in a fast-paced and ever-changing dynamic environment
Strong capability with quantitative and qualitative measures

You are Inspired? Great, here are now the next steps...

You will talk to MYA, our trusted chatbot to make sure you fulfill the necessary elements
You will answer 3 competency-based questions with Seedlink, our artificial intelligence tool, enabling us to see your cultural fit with L’Oréal (candidats having answered Seedlink are prioritized).
Exploratory HR Interview (Individual or Collective). Whether it is an Assessment Centre or an individual interview, it is always an exploratory discussion. The recruiter will guide you into a broad conversation to get to know you better and to spot the métier, division, brand and mission in which you will be able to better express your potential.
Operational interview with your potential future manager(s) to convince them that you are the best fit! It is also a great occasion to ask questions on what your tasks will be exactly, the team spirit and what how this internship will develop your competencies.

Go go go! We can't wait to meet you!

Votre Rôle
Doté de compétences à la fois analytiques, statistiques et ergonomiques, vous intégrez la direction Marketing et Digital en tant que Digital Marketing Analyst.

Au sein de l'équipe Insight et performance, vous aurez pour principales missions :

Assurer le support Web Analytics auprès des équipes métiers notamment par la réalisation d'analyses quantitatives et qualitatives des sources d'acquisition, des utilisateurs et de leur comportement

Préconiser des optimisations sur les actions du merchandising, de l'animation commerciale et du Marketing (Trafic, CRM).

Participer à la RoadMap des A/B tests , analyser et valider des recommandations d'optimisation au travers de campagnes de tests AB, MVT et personnalisation.

Responsable de l'évangélisation et sensibilisation à l'esprit data-driven au sein des équipes

Accompagner les équipes à l'utilisation des outils d'analytics et partager les insights

Le suivi de la collaboration avec nos éditeurs de solutions web analytics
Votre Profil
De formation Bac+4/5, vous bénéficiez d'une expérience significative de 2 à 3 ans minimum (hors stage) sur des fonctions similaires en interne ou en agence.

Rigoureux, vous avez un fort esprit d'analyse et de synthèse

Vous êtes en capacité de donner aux chiffres une portée business et stratégique

De plus, la maîtrise d'un outil de Tag Management est un réel atout pour ce poste.

Vous disposez de solides connaissances du marketing digital (Trafic, Social media, CRM, PRM, APP Mobile…) et de l'e-commerce (Merchandising, Animation commerciale, UX/UI…).

Vous êtes reconnu pour vos qualités relationnelles : Interaction avec plusieurs entités en interne et partenaires externes et faîtes preuve d'une grande curiosité d'esprit à l'égard du digital et des nouvelles technologies.

Overview
The Data Analytics Specialist is responsible for enabling data analytics to be performed across the Group Internal Audit function, by (a) providing data analytics know-how and support to the Group Internal Audit Hubs to enable them to perform their own local analytics, and (b) implementing, maintaining and enhancing a centralised data analytics platform for use by all Group Internal Audit staff.

The Data Analytics Specialist contributes to the development of Group Internal Audit in order help achieve its key objectives:
provide to the Group Board Audit Committee and to the CEO independent and objective assurance over internal control effectiveness in any of the Group’s entities and functions;
help improve effectiveness and efficiency of operations,
develop and share knowledge

The Data Analytics Specialist should also:
create, expand and maintain Group Internal Audit’s knowledge and tools to ensure continuous adaptation to the evolution of LafargeHolcim’s business.
support the development of LafargeHolcim's Audit department through acting as a «Technical Specialist» to enhance audit effectiveness and efficiency.

Responsibilities
Data Analysis
The Data Analytics Specialist:
Develops the data analytics framework for Group Internal Audit, covering processes, procedures and standards
Manage and maintain the technological infrastructure and data that support Internal Audit Analytics
Coordinates data analytics knowledge sharing across the Group Internal Audit Hubs and with other key stakeholders in the LafargeHolcim Group
Coordinates with LafargeHolcim’s IT organisation at Group and Regional levels to ensure access to the relevant data and the appropriate tools are in place to perform data analyses
Translates Group Internal Audit requirements into technical specifications, builds queries using data querying tools and tests the query results for appropriateness and completeness for:
The planning, fieldwork and reporting stages of individual Group Internal Audit missions
Wider Group Internal Audit management reporting, such as benchmarking, risk assessment, etc.
Join specific audit missions when ad-hoc advanced data analytics are required
Applies continuous improvement principle to mature data analytics in Group Internal Audit

Knowledge development & sharing
The Data Analytics Specialist should:

Develop and deliver training material to the Group Internal Audit staff on the use of audit and data analytics tools specifically, integrating those tools into standard audit practices.
Support Group Internal Audit staff in enhancing the audit approach and audit guides suggesting IT based audit procedures.
Develop and maintain relationships with other Group Assurance Providers (Line of Defense 2) to promote continuous monitoring analytics program.
Develop and maintain relationship with Group IT and Regional ITSCs to keep up-to-date on any technology and/or business process changes that may occur across the LafargeHolcim Group
Advise on any analytical technology tools or enhancements that would help the department realize efficiencies.
The Data Analytics specialist can also be assigned to projects aimed at improving Group Internal Audit’s performance and internal processes.

JOB DIMENSIONS:
Audited domains
Possibly all Group business processes and domains (Finance, Order to Cash, Source to Pay, Product Quality, etc.)

List of direct reports:
No direct reports

Reporting lines
The Data Analytics Specialist reports hierarchically to the Head of IT Audit Hub.
Key interfaces, stakeholders and relationships:
The Data Analytics Specialist develops effective working relationship with the IS/IT community, the Business Process Owners (at Group or Operation levels), the Group Internal Control team, and other assurance providers from the Line of Defense 2.
Education/Qualifications
Master of Science, Bachelor degree
CPA, CIA, CISA, ACL Certified Data Analyst and/or CFE considered as a plus
Experience
Mandatory: 3-5 years of proficiency in data analytics in a SAP environment
Good awareness of Internal Audit processes is a plus
Good knowledge of standard business processes is a plus
Knowledge & Skills
Technical / functional skills:
Mandatory:
SAP ERP technical skills & knowledge
Technical expertise with data analysis tools such as ACL and QlikView
Proficient in Databases – Data Architecture, Data Modeling, Data Loads, etc.
Knowledge of basic statistics (time series analysis, correlation, regression)
Behavioural competencies:
Integrity, alignment with Group values, humility,
Objectivity, courage, independence, fairness
Communication & interpersonal skills
Analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to evaluate risks in the context of the Group strategic vision
Result orientation
Language Requirements
English. Another language (French, Spanish, German…) is a plus
Travel Requirements
Up to ca. 40% travels

Titre: ASSISTANT DATA ANALYST & CHARGE D’ETUDES MARKETING (STAGE JA...
Descriptif_du_poste:
Job Description

Au sein de la direction Marketing et rattaché(e) au pôle CRM, vous participez activement à l’approfondissement de la connaissance client, pour contribuer au succès de Showroomprivé en France comme à l’international.
Vous intègrerez l’équipe « Observatoire Client », composé de 2 personnes, 1 Data Analyst et 1 Responsable Enquêtes.
Vous interviendrez sur ces 2 périmètres, afin d’acquérir une vision 360 du membre Showroomprivé. Vous prendrez part aux projets dans leur entièreté, de la compréhension des besoins jusqu'aux recommandations, en assurant également la diffusion des enseignements aux équipes concernées.
Vos principales missions :
Réaliser des études de profiling, pour construire ou optimiser le mix marketing dédié à la population analysée
Monitorer & enrichir la connaissance du cycle de vie client
Analyser les performances de certaines opérations marketing stratégiques, notamment via la mise en place de populations témoins
Réaliser ponctuellement des ciblages complexes
2 / Enquêtes clients
Mettre en place & analyser les enquêtes ad’hoc, que ce soit en relation avec des sociétés d’études ou via nos outils internes, autour de 2 axes majeurs :
Approfondir la connaissance des usages, les perceptions ou encore les attentes de nos cibles stratégiques
Pré-tester et/ou post-tester certaines nouveautés et/ou changements du mix marketing (fonctionnalités, offres, communications, etc.)
Monitorer la satisfaction client à travers l’analyse des enquêtes barométriques
Effectuer une veille permanente sur l’évolution des attentes clients, des actions concurrentielles, etc.

Qualifications

De formation supérieure (Bac+4/5), vous disposez idéalement d’une première expérience en data analyse et/ou en gestion d’enquêtes, en cabinet de conseil ou chez un annonceur. Une affinité avec les secteurs du retail / e-commerce serait appréciée.
Vous avez une bonne compréhension des enjeux du marketing relationnel et analytique, vous aimez les chiffres, maîtrisez Excel / PowerPoint, et avez des notions en langage SQL.
Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre force de proposition, votre rigueur, votre esprit d’analyse et votre aisance relationnelle. Anglais souhaité.

Additional Information

Stage de 6 mois à pourvoir pour Janvier 2020, basé dans nos locaux à La Plaine Saint Denis.

Key accountabilities :

Coordinate resources and compile information across the company to answer RFPs (follow RFP process by defining timeframe, identifying sources of information, highlighting critical items)
Work closely with a wide range of stakeholders/subject matter experts within AXA IM (sales managers, portfolio managers, product specialists, etc.) to gather all relevant inputs and to challenge investment solutions to deliver clear financial proposals
Structure RFPs with a marketing approach to promote AXA IM’s competitive advantages
Prepare and deliver top notch pitches: SWOT analysis, rehearsals, preparation of pitch books and Q&A
Ensure feedback is received subsequent to submitting the RFP and follow-up on action plans to contribute to the improvement of our offering and process
Maintain standard content in the RFP tool
Contribute to preparation of the RFP Reporting
Compile quantitative data (Performances and risk analytics, assets under management, staff)

Qualifications
Education / Qualifications
Finance-related degree

Experience
Prior experience working in the financial industry (RFP, sales, marketing, communications, investment management)
Excellent level of French and English


Knowledge and Skills
Excellent writing skills: enjoys writing and transforming technical descriptions into marketing documents, easy to read for non-specialists, with a strong emphasis on key selling points
Strong analytical skills and products knowledge
o ability to understand and describe investment processes and financial solutions in detail
o client focused
o ability to challenge experts (Sales, Product Specialists, etc.)
Good project management skills

Key Competencies
Team player: willingness to share know-how and to learn from others
Leadership/entrepreneurial spirit to take full responsibility for delivering the documents required, ability to build consensus between departments with different objectives
Enjoys working in an international environment
Works well under pressure
Curious, rigorous and well-organised
Excellent knowledge of MS Office tools
A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches? Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsible.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 166 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 103 millions de clients.
Nous sommes un investisseur global multi-actifs, qui privilégie le long terme et la gestion active, pour permettre au plus grand nombre d’atteindre ses objectifs financiers en exploitant tout le potentiel des solutions d’investissement. En associant une connaissance pointue de l’investissement et de l’innovation à une gestion solide des risques, nous sommes devenus l’un des acteurs majeurs de la gestion d’actifs en Europe, avec 746 milliards d’euros d’actifs à fin 2017. Nous employons 2 400 personnes à travers le monde et possédons 29 bureaux répartis dans 21 pays.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Nous sommes fiers de promouvoir une culture de la performance ce qui veut dire que nous cherchons à recruter des personnes qui sont non seulement compétents techniquement mais également ouverts à l'international, innovants et capable de mettre à contribution leurs uniques perspectives et expériences afin d'accompagner nos succès en tant qu'entreprise. Employer les meilleurs professionnels parmi le plus large vivier de talents possible est au cœur de notre stratégie qui consiste à délivrer une excellente qualité de service à notre clientèle diversifiée.
AXA IM s’engage à développer une culture inclusive, mettant en valeur la diversité et soutenant la progression de carrière de l’ensemble de ses collaborateurs et collaboratrices.

About your new firm:

Frontier is an economics consultancy that tackles the big questions facing governments, businesses and society. We support our clients on some of the most interesting, topical and high-profile issues across these areas. We help our clients to analyse and understand their markets and to formulate strategies based on sound economics. The methods and models we use are often complex, but our advice is always succinct, clear and honest. We use our analysis to provide insight into complex situations, giving clients jargon-free opinions and results that can withstand even the closest scrutiny.
We advise across sectors and countries and we are one of the largest economic consultancies in Europe with more than 200 Economists based in our offices in Brussels, Berlin, Cologne, Dublin, London, Paris and Madrid.
We go beyond the numbers to find out what’s really going on. Our clients enjoy objective advice, clearly expressed. With our help, they make better decisions and get better results.

What to expect during your Analyst Programme?

What is great about being a new analyst at Frontier, is that your programme lasts -two years allowing you plenty of opportunities to find out more about the working world of economics. You will have the opportunity to rotate across our different practices within Competition, Public Policy, Energy, Telecoms, Strategy and Transportation and Water, working alongside highly experienced economists. There is also the opportunity to work in one of our EMEA offices as part of your two year programme. You will attend a comprehensive induction week, held in London and attend weekly training sessions for the first six months. After six months, you will continue to have regular seminars, internal training and mentoring.
Plus, throughout the programme you’ll be supported by two experienced mentors and your graduate ‘buddy’ who will help support and guide you through your programme!

What will you be doing in your new role?

As part of a team and supported by your mentors and buddies you will:

Start working for our clients very early on with the support of more experienced consultants
Deliver robust and accurate technical or theoretical analysis
Share thoughts and ideas to solve client problems, involving internal and external meetings
Contribute to the writing of reports, slide packs or notes, written in a logical and well-structured manner using language appropriate for the intended audience
Apply economic frameworks, ranging from simple data analysis to complex econometric modelling
Present your findings to colleagues and clients
Continue to develop and grow your Excel, Stata and modelling skills
Collaborate with your project team/s, whilst also being able to work alone on a piece of analysis seeking support when required
Manage your own work and time to ensure you meet the agreed project deadlines, seeking advice from more experienced consultants as required.
Have the opportunity to work with Frontier economists across our EMEA offices and,
Play a part in the running of the firm working on projects that enhance our culture, working life and client experience.

About You

You will be a predicted or have obtained 2:1 Bachelor’s degree
in Economics (or equivalent from a university outside the UK) and a Masters in
Economics. We do accept applications from undergraduates however, you will be required to study a Masters part-time whilst working.

A propos d'AXA
Aimeriez-vous vous lever chaque jour motivé(e) par une mission inspirante et travailler en équipe pour permettre de protéger les personnes et leurs proches? Chez AXA nous avons l’ambition de mener la transformation de notre métier. Nous cherchons des personnes talentueuses ayant une expérience diversifiée, qui pensent différemment, et qui veulent faire partie de cette transformation passionnante en challengeant le statu quo et faire d’AXA – marque globale leader et une des sociétés les plus innovantes dans notre secteur – une entreprise encore plus performante et responsible.
Dans un monde en perpétuelle évolution et avec une présence dans 64 pays, nos 166 000 salariés et distributeurs privilégiés anticipent le changement pour offrir des services et solutions adaptés aux besoins actuels et futurs de nos 103 millions de clients.
Nous sommes un investisseur global multi-actifs, qui privilégie le long terme et la gestion active, pour permettre au plus grand nombre d’atteindre ses objectifs financiers en exploitant tout le potentiel des solutions d’investissement. En associant une connaissance pointue de l’investissement et de l’innovation à une gestion solide des risques, nous sommes devenus l’un des acteurs majeurs de la gestion d’actifs en Europe, avec 746 milliards d’euros d’actifs à fin 2017. Nous employons 2 400 personnes à travers le monde et possédons 29 bureaux répartis dans 21 pays.
Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?
Nous sommes fiers de promouvoir une culture de la performance ce qui veut dire que nous cherchons à recruter des personnes qui sont non seulement compétents techniquement mais également ouverts à l'international, innovants et capable de mettre à contribution leurs uniques perspectives et expériences afin d'accompagner nos succès en tant qu'entreprise. Employer les meilleurs professionnels parmi le plus large vivier de talents possible est au cœur de notre stratégie qui consiste à délivrer une excellente qualité de service à notre clientèle diversifiée.
AXA IM s’engage à développer une culture inclusive, mettant en valeur la diversité et soutenant la progression de carrière de l’ensemble de ses collaborateurs et collaboratrices.

A propos du poste
Au sein de la Direction Commerciale du Groupe située au siège, vous reportez au Directeur Commercial Grands Comptes et intégrez une équipe de 8 personnes. Dans ce cadre, vos principales missions sont : - Recueillir, analyser et synthétiser les informations et les données clients / prospects - Concevoir l’architecture d’un entrepôt de données décisionnelles (Data Warehouse) - Créer des indicateurs concernant les opportunités (volume, marge, qualification, taux de réussite ...) - Convertir, coder et cartographier des données de consommation ou d’usage produit dans un format compréhensible par l’ensemble des collaborateurs - Assurer un reporting mensuel des données : création de tableaux de bord mensuels sur plusieurs indicateurs - Réaliser des études spécifiques (analyse de comptes clients, de prospects, retours de salon et actions marketing, taux de transformation ...) - Effectuer une veille technologique et proposer des plans d’action dans le cadre de l’amélioration continue.

A propos de l'entreprise
SOGETREL est une ETI française indépendante qui, en plus de 30 années de conquête, est devenue un acteur national mature et reconnu sur le marché des télécoms, de la sûreté et des solutions digitales. Elle s'est imposée comme le partenaire privilégié des grands opérateurs publics et privés et des collectivités locales, en particulier dans le déploiement de réseaux Très Haut Débit (FTTH). Avec un chiffre d’affaires en progression de 20% par an et près de 500 millions d’euros en 2018, un effectif de 4 500 femmes et hommes, plus de 80 implantations en France, Suisse et Belgique, SOGETREL poursuit sa croissance sur les marchés en pleine expansion de l’aménagement numérique du territoire THD et accélère son développement dans les usages et solutions digitales.

DESCRIPTION
Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life?

Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 62 countries, our 160,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 105 million customers.

The headquarters of the AXA Group, based in Paris 8th, bring together the Group's corporate activities. It coordinates the various entities with the Group's strategy, and is responsible for managing international projects.

Direction Presentation:
AXA Group Risk Management (GRM) brings together high level and multidisciplinary staff with engineers, actuaries, data scientists and financials split between Paris, Zurich, Madrid and the US.
Its mains missions are focused on the following key areas:

Analyze, model and aggregate the Group’s risks (economic capital and emergence of economic value),
Define the process enabling to limit the undertaken risks (assets accumulation, longevity, natural catastrophe...)
Optimize the Group’s protection (reinsurance, securitization, etc.).

Primary mission:
As part of Solvency II regulation, AXA has developed its own internal model for the calculation of the economic capital. GRM Life team is responsible for the developments linked to the Life risks (Mortality, Longevity, Lapses, etc.) and works continuously on the model’s improvement and on the quantification of these risks.
As part of the implementation of IFRS17, the new international financial reporting standard, GRM Life team is also responsible for the developments linked to the Life Risk Adjustment (RA) component of IFRS17 framework.

The Life Internal Model team’s missions consist in coordinating and analyzing the AXA Group Solvency II Internal Model for Life Risks as well as IFRS17’s Life Risk Adjustment (RA).

The team directly reports to the Group’s Life, Savings and Health Chief Risk Officer.

Core activities:

Analyze and communicate on the Life Internal Model & the Life RA and their outputs
Analyze at Group and entity level the risk and business changes and their impact on the solvency ratio and IFRS17’s balance sheet
Explain the life model to the management, entities, auditors and supervisors
Be proactive to improve the Internal Model and RA accuracy
Understand the tools developed as part of the Life Internal Model and the Life Risk Adjustment
Coordinate the entities and GRM Life team’s network on the Life Internal Model and Life RA topics
Make the link between the entities and the Group to meet the schedule and project deliverables, to better understand their business and modelling issues
Work in coordination with GRM Life team experts to solve issues related to the risks they are in charge of
Enhance the Internal Model use test
Use the Internal Model not only for regulatory purposes but also for studies and monitoring of every day


QUALIFICATIONS
Technical and professional skills:

Knowledge of SII and IFRS17 frameworks
Technical and analysis skills on life risks
Process / project management abilities
Communication skills and negotiation abilities
Fluent written and spoken English

Soft skills and competencies:

Be able to work with a team in a multicultural environment
Be able to communicate with various stakeholders (Life CROs, actuarial experts, auditors, regulators)
Demonstrate accuracy, quality and timeliness of deliverables
Be organized, autonomous, have a sense of responsibilities
Be innovative and flexible, show ability to listen and pragmatism

Management Skills:
The position could entail the management of an intern.
Experience:

Major in statistics, actuarial sciences, finance, “Ecole” (ENSAE, ISFA, ISUP, EURIA…), Master (BAC+5) or PhD
2 to 5 years in an insurance company or a consulting firm with an experience on Life risks, Finance or modeling

Bank of America Merrill Lynch – Data and Innovation Group, Scientific Implementation
R&D Associate
The Bank of America Merrill Lynch R&D Center in Paris aims to further develop research and innovation initiatives within Bank of America. The Center in conjunction with relevant global groups at Bank of America Merrill Lynch focuses on the increase of research capabilities of the franchise, provides further bandwidth to investigate new strategies and methods, and contributes to the increase of market position in innovation-related fields. The underlying scientific approach is cutting edge. Teams pursue projects on the research frontier; they develop new ideas or investigate an unanswered scientific question. The scope of the projects varies from asset pricing topics to market microstructure and portfolio optimization.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Associates at the Bank of America Merrill Lynch R&D Center in Paris are recent graduates with a PhD qualification and research experience in the fields of financial economics, data science and machine-learning, and applied mathematics. Research associates are expected to work on cutting edge research projects related to their area of expertise. They work independently or as part of teams and take a leading role in generating new project ideas and initiatives Active engagement with the broader team in the communication and promotion of their team’s work is an important part of the role. Part of the Academic Research produced by the team is expected to be published in top academic and practitioners’ journals (Journal of Finance, Journal of Financial Economics, Review of Financial Studies, Financial Analysts Journal, Journal of Portfolio Management, or other journals of similar recognition and impact factor). Research associates report to research supervisors with whom they discuss about the progress made in the projects and next steps in the process.
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
Excellent academic background with a doctoral degree in one of the following principles: Financial Economics (Macro-finance, Asset Pricing, Microstructure), Econometrics, Data Science, Machine-learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, and Applied Physics
Ability to independently carry out quantitative analysis projects starting from idea generation to delivering final deliverables
Reliable and capable of delivering high-quality work on time
Experience in empirical work and ability to handle large datasets
Sound economic/financial intuition and enthusiasm about implementing new ideas
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Creativity and ability to work independently or in a team as well as strong interpersonal communicational skills
Extensive programming skills in statistical/computational environments such as Python, or R. Knowledge of Matlab, Stata, SQL, LaTeX is desirable
Posting Date: 09/09/2019
Location:
49-51 Rue La Boetie
France

Nos interventions
Tu as plusieurs expériences réussies et tu souhaites développer tes connaissances au contact d'experts au sein d'une structure à taille humaine capable de vous accompagner dans votre progression.
Ainsi tu rejoindras la première concentration de consultants certifiés par l'éditeur SAS pour apprendre au quotidien sur des problématiques clients :
Recueil des besoins utilisateurs,
Mise en place des développements (extraction, manipulation, calcul d'indicateurs, etc.),
Production des reportings et des tableaux de bord nécessaires,
Former et assurer le support aux utilisateurs,
Rédiger la documentation et industrialiser les procédures.
Tout ce qu'il faut pour prendre du plaisir au quotidien, non ? Pour nous ce n'est pas encore assez... c'est pour cela que nous avons aussi des sujets "In House".
In House
En parallèle de nos missions, nous organisons de nombreux projets internes baptisés "ThinkTank" qui alimentent notre R&D. Ces projets nous permettent aujourd'hui de proposer et faire tester à nos clients de façon grandeur nature les approches DATA de demain.
Tu vas pouvoir échanger, discuter et grandir au contact de la communauté AVISIA d’experts SAS reconnus (AVISIA est la 1ère concentration de certifiés SAS en France).
Pour tout cela, nous avons développé notre propre environnement d'early adopteur des nouvelles solutions SAS.
Cerise sur le gâteau, notre partenariat Gold avec SAS te permettra de te perfectionner et surtout de te certifier.

L'humain
Nous recherchons donc des talents ayant le goût pour le travail en équipe, motivés pour s'impliquer sur des projets transverses et souhaitant évoluer dans un environnement de Data Engineerie.
Les compétences
Tu maitrises le développement sur les modules SAS (Base, Macro, SQL, Graph, Enterprise Guide, Visual Analytics, …),
Tu utilises aussi le SQL et tu sais modéliser les BDD en étoiles ou en flocons,
Ta connaissance d'un outil de d'administration de la plateforme SAS serait un plus,
Salaire : selon ton expérience avec des mécaniques valorisantes, incitatives & motivantes.

Un process de recrutement court et efficace :
Déroulement :
Un 1er rendez vous avec un manager opérationnel pour échanger sur tes experiences et te présenter nos missions (tu seras aussi soumis à un test).
Un after work avec des consultants pour te permettre de juger de l'ambiance interne et poser toutes les questions que tu n'as pas osé lors du 1er rendez-vous.
Une rencontre avec un des partners du cabinet pour finaliser le processus.
Durée :
Chez AVISIA, notre volonté est que tout se déroule en maximum 10 jours ouvrés. Pas mal, non ?

Financial Analyst
Position in based in Paris office
PeopleDoc is on a mission to define a new generation of employee experience in
the enterprise.
Adopted by many of the world’s top companies, PeopleDoc’s cloud-based HR Service Delivery platform empowers employees to quickly and easily access relevant HR information while providing HR organizations with the tools to be more effective. With offices in the U.S. and Europe, PeopleDoc currently serves more than 1000 customers globally and was recognized in 2014 by Gartner as a Cool Vendor in Human Capital Management. PeopleDoc is fueled by innovation and positioned to become the leader of the HR Service Delivery space.
Job Description/ Job Summary:
PeopleDoc SAS is looking for a Financial Analyst to join our growing Finance team in Paris . The Financial analyst is in charge of creating, updating, and maintaining financial models and detailed forecasts of the company’s future operations. They are also involved in comparison analysis of historical results against budgets and forecasts (costs analysis per department, revenue analysis per type of revenue, source of revenue, bookings transformation analysis). He/she performs variance analysis to explain differences in performance and make improvements going forward.

Finally, the Financial analyst is involved into integration process, following PeopleDoc acquisition by Ultimate Software.
As part of this integration process, he/she is required to actively participate in:
FP&A process alignment between PeopleDoc & Ultimate Software
expansion of mother company’s financial planning tool
communication of new procedures & process within management population

Day to day tasks will include to:
Update input information into forecast model (headcount, costs, revenue),
Perform Actuals versus budget & Actuals versus forecast gaps analysis,
Contribute to a preparation of financial presentations for Internal direction
committees, Country managers, etc
Prepare historical data analysis for reporting or integration process needs
Respond to any analysis requests from the management & direction (local & headquarter’s level)
Participate in budget compaign & quarterly closing planning & preparation
Open/close/modify access to FP&A tools (currently Anaplan) as well as to Netsuite (for expense reports, R&D time tracking) The successful candidate will possess the following required

Competencies:
Master’s degree (Bac +5) in Accounting, Finance or equivalent. An experience in Software Development, Computer Hardware, and understanding Financial Planning & Analysis is a plus.
Min 1 years of professional experience,
Capacity of handling and intelligently analyzing a mountain of different types of data and data evaluation metrics,
Creative problem solver, with a natural or cultivated talent for financial
analysis, modeling, and forecasting,
Strong organizational and time management skills,
Proficient in Excel: mandatory,
Fluent in French and English

Titre: Data Scientist, Optimisation and Trading Analysis
Descriptif_du_poste:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Data Scientist to join the Optimisation & Trading Analytical Team.
The Data Scientist will be in charge of the design and development of optimisation and trading applications with a strong impact on the business with a particular focus on short term power markets. We are looking for a motivated individual with good technical skills and interest in the energy sector and commodities trading. This position would be best suited to a candidate with 0-3 years of experience.

Main responsibilities

Design, develop and test Data Science models to support EDFT activities. Make the models available through tools and dashboards to ensure their results are fully leveraged.
Present and explain the result of models to internal stakeholders, demonstrate the value created through pertinent back-testing and analysis
Work in close collaboration with the trading desks and analysts to discuss results and identify model improvement opportunities
Participate to the improvement of the team existing processes, tools and models to increase performance and reliability of applications

Experience and technical requirements


Essential requirements:

Good working knowledge of Data Science techniques

Strong programming skills (in Python or another relevant language)
Higher education degree in a quantitative subject (Maths, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, …)
Interest in energy markets
Beneficial requirements :

Experience of power markets (modelling, asset optimisation, portfolio management, trading)

Knowledge of optimisation techniques (linear programing, mixed integer programming)

Experience in Java, SQL and noSQL databases, web technologies for front-end development

Person specification


Hands-on approach, flexible and positive attitude

Fast learner

Strong work ethic

Excellent communication skills

Team player and customer oriented

French language beneficial

Hours of work:
210 days worked per year

Titre: Energy Modelling Analyst—Hydrogen and Renewable Gas
Descriptif_du_poste:
IHS Markit is looking to recruit a highly quantitative individual with a deep interest in the future evolution of the global energy sector. The Paris-based role sits at the core of the global gas team which delivers regular retainer and consulting services to a wide client base from across the gas and power value chain. The team is part of a global gas, power and energy futures research group that allows IHS Markit to deliver unrivaled insights into the future direction of global energy markets.
The postholder will:
Contribute and be responsible for the operation and maintenance of IHS Markit’s global hydrogen and renewable gas model—the model that underpins our outlooks for future deployment of renewable gases and hydrogen derived fuels. Output from the model informs the global energy balance, demand and supply of natural gas and the capacity and generation mix in the power sector
In conjunction with the Director of Renewable Gases & Hydrogen, undertake research into new technologies to produce, transport, storage and use low carbon gases and synthetic liquids.
Responsible for the accurate and timely delivery of a range of reports and analysis including regular reviews of national energy policy related to low carbon gases
Working with other member of the global gas and power teams to develop long term outlooks for the demand, supply and cost of renewable gases and synthetic liquids globally
Job requirements
An advanced degree in a highly quantitative subject. A degree in energy engineering, thermal sciences or chemical & process engineering preferred
Capacity to understand and analyze technical reports and collect critical data and insights
Detail oriented person with experience in developing, documenting and maintaining energy related models
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel for modeling and data analysis required
The candidate must be able to work independently and collaboratively
Although not essential the following experience would be desirable:
Experience in the gas, power or industrial hydrogen markets either in the industry or in an advisory capacity
Detailed understanding of hydrogen production technologies
Knowledge of operation of gas value chain, sector coupling and related energy policies
Experience of data analytics and visualization tools

Job Description

In the team, and with the help, of a Senior Global Portfolio Manager and a Senior Global Fund Manager, you will perform fundamental research on industries, markets, companies, products and/or services. This will involve using resources such as Bloomberg and/or Factset to gather financial data to be analyzed.

Projects assigned will be directed at deepening Analyst specific industry and company analysis to help inform stock selection. This will include both qualitative and quantitative analyses, such as market segmentation, competitive position, market share trends, pricing dynamics, industry and company profitability as well as comparable company analyses and financial modeling.

You will be expected to synthesize large amounts of data on the above areas of focus into concise and actionable insights in a timely matter.
If you know already a specific industry (e.g. consumer, tech) having worked 3 years minimum in a global management consulting company, this will allow you to suggest your investment ideas too.

Qualifications

You have a master degree in Economics or Business finance oriented
You have a first experience in a Global Management Consulting Company, preferably in the UK, US or Canada
You speak perfectly English (French speaking is an asset)
You have a good knowledge of Excel (VBA is an asset)
Genuine intellectual curiosity and drive to learn. Self-starter. Ability to make decisions with imperfect information.
Exceptional analytical and research skills.
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Ability to work independently on complex projects as well as be a strong team player. High level of maturity and professionalism expected.
Strong academic track record, SAT, GPA and rigorous course work.
Demonstrated leadership skills both academically and extracurricular

Votre environnement de travail
Les véhicules autonomes en cours de développement intègrent des systèmes très complexes. Pour atteindre le niveau de fiabilité requis pour leur mise en circulation sur route ouverte, les plans de validation doivent être réalisés sur une dizaine de milliards de kilomètres. La validation ne pouvant se faire entièrement au physique, la simulation massive se présente comme une réelle alternative pour exposer au numérique le véhicule testé à un grand nombre de situations susceptibles d’être rencontrées au réel. Les données issues des simulations sont considérables et hétérogènes. En effet, elles seront à la fois liées aux systèmes testés et à l’environnement des tests simulés (routes, marquages au sol, infrastructure). Pour détecter les éventuelles défaillances du véhicule autonome (false négative, false positive), et leurs causes, une analyse fine des données de simulation doit être réalisée. Pour réaliser une telle tâche, des compétences à la fois de manipulation de données massive (Big Data) et d’analyse statistique et intelligence artificielle seront cruciales.

Vous serez intégré à une équipe au cœur des challenges que permet l'accélération du numérique. Les équipes travaillent en coopération avec les équipes systèmes, les équipes de la prestation client et les équipes informatiques afin de piloter, réaliser et déployer la stratégie pour la mise en place de plateformes de simulations pour la validation du véhicule autonome et des ADAS.

Vos missions
Dans le cadre de la validation du véhicule autonome et des ADAS, vous participerez à la mise en place des outils, méthodes ainsi que l'analyse des données de simulations massives. vous serez amené(e) à :

1) Agréger des données venant de la simulation massive (AD/ADAS) pour identifier et analyser les causes internes et externes des défaillances systèmes
2) Identifier les indicateurs les plus pertinents permettant d’analyser de façon efficace les données de simulations
3) Etablir les rapports de synthèse des données de simulations analysées
4) Participer à la veille technologique des outils numériques pour les manipulations de données massives et leurs analyses
5) Participer à la définition des méthodes et des outils d’analyse permettant de valider le véhicule autonome, véhicule connecté dans un environnement de simulation HPC
6) Assurer la cohérence et la synthèse des données pour la validation des ADAS, véhicule autonome véhicule/connecté dans un environnement de simulation massive (HPC)
7) Définir avec les métiers de l’ingénierie systèmes les données cruciales pour l’analyse des simulations du véhicule Autonome et des ADAS

Dans votre mission vous serez conduit à travailler avec les équipes de la direction des systèmes ainsi que la direction des prestations véhicules.
Ce poste vous donnera l'opportunité de travailler sur les techniques et outils les plus avancées pour la validation des innovations AD/ADAS
A votre arrivée, nous vous proposerons un dispositif d’accueil pour vous permettre de mieux connaître votre entité, le Groupe et ses enjeux, et de rencontrer d'autres nouveaux embauchés. Vous pourrez par la suite bénéficier de formations au long de votre parcours professionnel dans l’entreprise.
Qui êtes-vous ?
Vous êtes diplômé(e) Ingénieur Informatique avec option Mathématiques Appliquées ou Ingénieur Généraliste avec option automatisme ou modélisation multidimensionnelle.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance en analyse de données massives
Vous avez une bonne connaissance en outils de gestion de données massives
Vous maitrisez les langages de développement informatique tel que Python, C, ou encore MATLAB
Vous avez une bonne compétences en méthodes statistiques de gestion de données (Big Data)
Une expérience de simulation numérique dans le domaine de l'automobile serait un plus.
Expérience en gestion et analyse de données massives.
Un niveau minimum de 750 au TOEIC est requis pour toute embauche cadre chez Renault. Si vous n'avez pas encore passé le TOEIC au moment de votre candidature, vous pourrez le faire au cours du processus de recrutement de Renault.
Evoluer vers des postes de managements, expertises, gestion de projets dans le domaine de la validation des ADAS et du véhicule autonome.
Vous souhaitez participer à l'aventure de l'automobile de demain ? Rejoignez-nous !

Overview
You’re driven, resourceful, and above all else - remarkably smart.

You love a good challenge. You are the first to roll up your sleeves and work with relentless energy until you solve the unsolvable, beat the unbeatable and you always come out on top. Passable doesn’t cut it – you’ve got fire in your belly to learn more, do more and be more. For you, the sweetest success is shared success and you’re known for your good nature. You’ll fit right in at Syneos Health where we surround ourselves with the most talented and agile professionals in the industry, but we check our egos at the door.

Why Syneos Health? Join a game-changing global company that is reinventing the way therapies are developed and commercialized. Created through the merger of two industry leading companies - INC Research and inVentiv Health - we bring together more than 21,000 clinical and commercial minds to create better, smarter, faster ways to get biopharmaceutical therapies to patients. Teaming with some of the most talented professionals in the industry, you'll gain exposure and work in a dynamic environment where you'll be supported with comprehensive resources including emerging technologies, data, science and knowledge sharing. Grow your career with a global company committed to shortening the distance from lab to life.
Responsibilities
This opportunity is with Syneos Health Consulting, an industry-leading consulting firm specializing in the biopharmaceutical industry providing services across a comprehensive range of key Practice Areas including commercial strategy and planning, medical affairs, risk and program management and pricing and market access. You’ll join a team with industry focus, depth of functional expertise, and strong scientific and market knowledge that is uniquely positioned to tackle highly complex business and market challenges to develop achievable strategies for our clients.
Conduct and compile routine and complex secondary research based on the research requirements communicated by the project lead or delegated team member(s)
Interpret research requirements and continually develop mastery of information sources to identify, retrieve, filter, and synthesize information with some manager assistance
Deliver information in various formats that address user requirements and resource capabilities
With some manager assistance, communicate information in a logical, clear, concise, and consolidated fashion, avoiding unnecessary jargon and “library-speak”
Perform all individually assigned tasks on time, within budget, and to an exemplary level of quality
Assisting in the design/development of economic models in collaboration with clients, clinical experts
Collecting economic or cost data, programming of economic model and/or statistical analysis
Assisting in the conduct of (systematic) literature reviews in collaboration with other team members
Preparing and final reports, manuscripts, posters and presentations
Depending on prior degree (providing statistical and technical support to clients and other members in the European team)
Help to develop well-structured, well-written, and attractively laid-out, high-quality documents that meet Syneos Health Consulting standards
Participate in internal improvement initiatives to enhance Syneos Health Consulting's capabilities in structuring and packaging services, developing methodologies, building firm infrastructure, and developing intellectual capital with direction from Manager.
Job Requirements
Along with demonstrated initiative, uncompromised integrity and a results-oriented mindset, the ideal candidate has:
Higher degree required in Health Economics along with either a medical/pharmacy/biology or statistical-type degree (or equivalent)
Experience with conduct and presentation of research required in the healthcare field
Excellent written and verbal skills in English and at least one other language
Excellent Microsoft Office skills
Good problem solving skills required
The drive for self-development, the ability to collaborate, and an action-oriented work ethic
Make your work matter everywhere. Be a driving force in a rapidly evolving healthcare industry.

About Dashlane

Dashlane is a password manager and online security app for everyone who lives, works, and plays on the internet. With a simple, intuitive design and patented security technology, Dashlane keeps passwords, personal data, and payment info at people's fingertips, so they can stop guessing passwords and wasting time filling out forms. Dashlane has helped over 12 million users in 180 countries manage and secure their digital identities and has enabled over $17 billion in e-commerce transactions. Our team in Paris, New York and Lisbon is united by our passion for password security and the belief that our success is built on the diverse backgrounds of every member.

At Dashlane you will:
Work with a talented team of developers, product and project managers, designers, and marketers on both sides of the Atlantic (Paris, Lisbon & New York)
Be actively involved in product decisions and share ownership in the company's success
Evolve in a fast-growing company, where you will make a significant impact!
As our QA Analyst, you will be...

Validating and verifying the applications, in accordance with the requirements and product/design specifications
Identifying and reporting defects, following bug life cycle
Collaborating with developers, product and project managers, other QA members and outsourced QA testers in an Agile environment
Writing QA documentation, and reporting quality assessments to all stakeholders
You will be based in Paris.

Requirements:
Experience writing test specs, test cases, and test plans
Experience in acceptance tests, smoke tests, regression tests
Fluent in verbal and written English
A demonstrated product-oriented mindset, creativity, and initiative to improve product test coverage and effectiveness
Nice-To-Haves:
Experience in diverse software quality assurance engineering environments on a variety of platforms, such as desktop and web applications, mobile devices, websites, etc.
You know how to use various Bug Tracking and Test Case Management software, like JIRA
You have knowledge in testing and improving the quality of applications on different platforms
Diversity at Dashlane:
A true international company, founded in Paris and currently split between Paris, New York, and Lisbon, we thrive off diverse perspectives. We recognize that diversity has different aspects: gender, sexual orientation, ability, ethnic origin, social background, age, lifestyle, and more. We're committed to hiring people that create a diverse community and foster a culture where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging.

FinKey, c’est quoi ?
Chez FinKey, nous sommes convaincus que la force des réseaux d'affaires constitue la clé de réussite du financement d'un projet d’entreprise.
Notre volonté ? Initier et accélérer les opportunités d’affaires entre les experts en financement, les financeurs et les dirigeants d'entreprise.
Créée en 2017 et incubée au B612 à Lyon (incubateur FinTech), FinKey est une start-up qui a développé en interne un outil permettant de tracer simplement le chemin de l’entreprise à ses financeurs.
Grâce à des algorithmes de matching innovants, FinKey
Qualifie le projet d’entreprise, les financeurs et les experts en financement ;
Identifie les contreparties financières les plus adaptées au projet (banques, investisseurs, organismes publics, etc.) ;
Sélectionne l’expert (courtier, leveur de fonds, expert de l’innovation…) qui détient l’accès privilégié au financeur idéal pour réussir l’opération de financement.
Enfin, FinKey a créé un modèle économique collectif qui valorise les compétences et les réseaux de chacun. Ainsi, l’entreprise bénéficie d’un accompagnement à 360° sur toutes les thématiques du financement grâce à un réseau d’experts de terrain sans surcoût financier.
Tu es un talent de la Finance ?
En relation directe avec les co-fondateurs et nos responsables régionaux, tu les assisteras dans l’analyse et l’exécution des opérations de financement (haut et bas de bilan) ainsi que dans le développement de la plateforme numérique.
Tu auras pour principales missions :
Analyse financière, économique et stratégique des sociétés accompagnées ;
Modélisation de montages financiers (business plan, valorisation, table de capitalisation etc.) ;
Rédaction de la documentation nécessaire à l’opération (teaser / mémo) ;
Suivi et relation financeurs dans le cadre (i) de l’exécution des dossiers de financement et (ii) dans l’identification de leurs besoins pour le développement de la plateforme ;
Constitution d’une data base des acteurs du financement et leurs critères d’intervention.
Tu seras également sollicité(e) pour enrichir le projet de plateforme numérique et donner ta vision du monde financier de demain.
En quelques mots, il s’agit d’une expérience pluridisciplinaire où tu seras amené(e) à travailler sur de nombreuses problématiques. Ce poste te permettra d’avoir une vision globale du financement de l’entreprise. C’est aussi l’opportunité d’approfondir tes connaissances au sein d’une start-up en plein essor.
En contrepartie : pas de bla bla, du talent !
Pour participer à l’aventure !
# Formation
Ton diplôme nous importe peu, seul ton talent et ta motivation comptent.
Une 1ère expérience professionnelle dans un fonds d’investissement, cabinet M&A / levée de fonds et cabinet de conseil sera appréciée. Ta fibre entrepreneuriale et ton intérêt pour travailler dans l’environnement d’une start-up Fintech sont essentiels pour nous accompagner dans ce projet digital d’intermédiation financière.
# Les 4 « P » de FinKey
Personne curieuse
Personne autonome
Personne qui sait travailler en équipe
Personne qui n’a pas peur de relever des défis
Si tu te reconnais dans ce profil, nous t'invitons à nous transmettre ta candidature.
Say Hello !
Merci d’envoyer ta candidature (CV + « pas » une lettre de motivation mais ce qui te semble pertinent pour travailler avec nous)

analyste financier h/f ou similaire: 1 an (Souhaité)

The goal of Amazon Logistics is to build an excellent last mile operation. Amazon aims to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders are delivered quickly, accurately, and in the most cost effective way as possible.

S&OP is a highly visible and critical role in Amazon from driving ownership, earning trust of stakeholders to delivering results. This position involves regular communication with operations, central planning teams, development and tech to keep plans & goals aligned, project sponsors on status, risks and change control, highlighting and deep diving on performance of forecasting and building robust feedback loops to improve the outputs . This role will oversees the coordination and administration of all aspects of an on-going program including volume and capacity forecasting and execution, software designing and driving process improvements across various stakeholders from Fulfillment centers, Amazon Middle Mile services, and delivery station operational teams.

Stakeholder management, cross-team coordination, solid writing and communication skills are must other than analytical needs. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, enjoying working with large scale of data, a curious builder who thrives in a fast-paced environment. The person has a strong delivery record and leadership experience to own and execute strategic, cross-functional projects, along with an innate ability to drive data driven decisions.

Build strategic plans to fulfil customer demand at the cheapest and in a cost efficient way.

Lead daily, weekly, monthly S&OP cycles with operational stakeholders.
Highlight misses, direct appropriate closure actions within supply chain.

Work with business teams to define requirements and high-level process/system solutions.
Drive standardization of tools and processes to build scalable execution plans with operations team.
As part of EU planning standardization team, lead the tools adoption and share best practices.
Manage the timelines with partner teams to support project launches, and driving improvements.

Titre: Business Analyst Planning (M/F) - Barcelone or Paris
Descriptif_du_poste:
We are papernest.
We have a dream, a world without paperwork. A world where administrative phobics like us live finally protected from the anguish of the forms filling and surcharges for late payment.
On the other hand, we will not lie to you, there is much work to do. That's why we are looking for committed, creative and enthusiastic people like you.
Since 2015, we’ve been working hard. In France there is 3.5 million moves per year, and 76% of French feel stressed about this event, so we decided to attack this area starting from this opportunity. As a result, we have created the only platform that allows you to transfer all your contracts when you move, 100% free, 100% online. Celebrating our fourth anniversary, we have more than 300 employees, we have accompanied over 250,000 users, and we opened an office in Barcelona in 2018.
We think big: bubbling ideas all around the world, a future where our entire administrative life is just a click away.
Our Barcelona operations office has experienced a tremendous staff increase since its opening: from 0 to 150 employees over the last 15 months. This is just the beginning ! With the opening of new countries, Barcelona will be our European hub and will keep growing.
The diversification of our acquisition channels (Inbound, Outbound, Chat, Mail) coupled with the geographic expansion of our offer (France, Spain) and our willingness to test new approaches regularly have resulted in complicating our Operations Team with creation.
In this context, we are looking for a Business Analyst Planning to build a capacity plan for our Operations, lead and deliver clear effective planning and real time monitoring and participate in scaling our activites through organization mechanisms.
Requirements
Your missions will be
Roadmap management
Deploy and maintain on a regular basis an operation roadmap enabling the Direction to have a clear global and detailed view on FTE presents and requirements.
Challenge regularly KPIs assumptions to ensure plans are on track and adjust needs for each country and production unity.
Follow up the collaborators are delivered at the right time and early signs of deviation are understood, translated and actions are agreed with the COO.
Develop a model by which headcount capacity and demand can be forecasted (monthly, weekly and hourly)
Planning management
Be responsible for designing, delivering and implementing a shift of strategies that are workable for our experts & supervisors both in Paris & Barcelona, for cost effective and to deliver people at the right time. This will be done in collaboration with Operations, Recruitment and Training Teams and considering the local legislation rules.
Be the main point of contact for advance production of recruitment planning, training planning and day-to-day planning : day-off, holidays and “bolsa de horas” validation.
Ensure a work/life balance in our different operations centers to embed a positive culture in our operations.
Day-to-day production running
Drive the flow of calls in real time and allocate appropriate skills to the right people in order to optimize in an efficient way both QoS and Transformation Rate.
Monitor our telephony system (Odigo) and always look for optimizing our call flow architecture to improve both customer journey and ROI.
Analyse data trends to identify and drive improvement in Operations delivery to always upgrade our customers’ satisfaction.
Be in charge of creating and maintaining up-to-date the deck of numerous partners login & password for each of our Operations collaborators (SaleForce, SDA, mail account, …).
Benefits
We look for
Minimum 3 years of experience in workforce management (ideally in BPO industry).
Analytical mind and at ease with numbers.
Good knowledge in SQL language.
Capacity to design automated tools.
Quality of presentation, of synthesis and give regular feedback.
Experience within planification tools (InVision, Injixo) & telephony system (Odigo) is a plus.

Company presentation
World leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 66,000 employees and serves more than 3,6 million customers and patients.
Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.
Air Liquide’s ambition is to lead its industry, deliver long-term performance and contribute to sustainability.

Entity and activity description
The , Air Liquide Benelux Industries-Large Industries (LI) Business Development department is based in Brussels and Rotterdam. It is in charge of LI sales contract management (1B€ portfolio) and the development of new LI projects (from requirements’ definition to contract signature).
You will join a team of 7 business developers with various nationalities (Belgian, Dutch, Canadian, French), working closely with, Air Liquide Benelux Industries-Large Industrie’ top management.

Missions and Responsibilities
Hydrogen & carbon monoxide production units and cogeneration plants take part in the EU-ETS (Emissions Trading Scheme). Consequently, each production facility is entitled to receiving “Free Allocations” and has the obligation to monitor and compensate yearly for its CO2 emissions. In 2013, this additional liability for Air Liquide Benelux Industries’ has been transposed into Air Liquide Benelux Industries’ existing sales contracts for the ETS Phase 3 period ending in December 2020, ensuring our customers compensate for their fair share of ALBI’s emissions. New rules for Phase 4 will be enforced as from January 2021 and ALBI must update its sales contracts accordingly and this by end 2020 at the latest.
You will work within a specific dedicated project team, on the deployment of Air Liquide Benelux Industries’ commercial strategy under the supervision of the head of the Business Development Department and in close cooperation with the Energy Management Department.
The goal of your mission will be to support the contract negotiations related to CO2 with the customers
Your mission will consist in:
analysing the impact of the new CO2 regulations and find ways to create value for each customer over the long-term
playing a key role in the Business Development organization by collaborating with the Business Developers during customer meetings, where your expertise will be key to guide discussions
Providing strategic and operational insights to feed discussions and negotiations with various analyses requested by customers and/or Air Liquide Benelux Industries management
drafting contract amendments and reviewing with legal department
supporting all business developers on ETS Phase 4 related topics


Competencies and Profile
Education : Masters’ degree of Science in Engineering (civil, industrial, chemistry, bio, ...). What really counts is your ability and willingness to continuously develop yourself and work in a team.
Data Analytical skills: you will need to deep dive into lots of data and analytical tools to answer questions from ALBI customers and/or management and develop solutions when required.
Communication skills: you will attend meetings with customers and will prepare all communication/presentation material therefore. Clear and customer oriented communication will be key.
Transversal management skills : you will be at the heart of a dynamic organisation, working closely together with members of many different departments.
Learning agility and result-orientation will be key to perform and take the most of this first professional experience.
Eagerness to learn
Strong analytical skills
Good communication skills
Intercultural skills: you are empathetic and eager to work with team members within different countries.
Bilingual: English, French and/or Dutch are required. English/French/Dutch is a real plus.

Additional information
Job based in Brussels, Belgium for an initial 12 months period with a possible extension of additional 12 months period.

Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!
Who we are
Altus Group is a leading provider of independent advisory services, software and data solutions to the global commercial real estate industry. Our business reflects decades of experience, a range of expertise and technology-enabled capabilities. Our solutions empower clients to analyse, gain market insight and recognise value on their real estate investments. Headquartered in Canada, we have approximately 2,500 employees around the world, with operations in North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific.
We are at the centre of what drives the real estate industry and continue to break ground every day with innovative solutions and best practices that touch every aspect of the real estate life cycle.
Who we need
Altus Group has an opportunity for a QA Analyst to join our team in Paris working on the ARGUS Taliance product. This is a manual QA tester role, with an opportunity to dig deep and broaden your skills, including introducing automation.
Who you are
An innovative problem-solver, you are flexible but process-focused and you know how to balance urgency with long-term payoff. You are a linear thinker; yet, you are incredibly adept at thinking of all possible answers. You are never in a panic but you know how to get work done quickly, and accurately. Integrity of test results is your priority and you are on a continuous search for improvements.
What’s in it for you
Influence, autonomy and career growth. If you are in a QA role within an enterprise organization, this is a chance to move into a start-up-like environment, and gain exposure to automation testing, business analyst work, and product development. We need a QA Analyst who enjoys working in small teams, at a fast-pace, in two week sprints; jumping from discussions with product managers to developers. You want to focus on the big picture and the details. This is a growing company with multiple global products; a place where you can gain exposure to different teams and tools, rapidly growing your skillset and your career.
Here’s what our QA Analyst will do:
Be Agile. You will actively participate in weekly sprints and deliverables, contributing to endorsement, sizing, planning and retrospectives.
Manual and automated testing. You will test newly developed features as well as conduct regression testing of the existing system to ensure a high quality of software. You will:
Work across all areas of the system including modeling, financial reports, UI, UX and integration (CSV, Database, ARGUS Enterprise, etc.).
Analyze feature requirements and devise appropriate and thorough test plans.
Create and execute weekly test plans.
Produce complex test data that reflects how our clients use the system. This involves developing a good understanding of the structure of Real Estate Investment Management data and reporting.
Script tests and automate them as much as possible.
Collaborate. You will work alongside the development team and product management team to resolve all issues as efficiently as possible. You will also work closely with the client support team to address and track cases raised by clients, generating a weekly report for the group on quality KPIs.
Be proactive. You will conduct research, suggest solutions, and generally do whatever it takes.
Challenge. You will proactively raise relevant issues and risks to the team, and follow up as needed. You will ask questions and challenge acceptance criteria, to ensure clarity and completeness from a QA standpoint.
How do we know that’s you? You have:
Education. You have a diploma or degree, ideally but not required in computer science or a related discipline.
Transparent communication style - and bilingualism. You have outstanding written and verbal skills in French and English. You are able to relay - and comprehend - both user requirements and technical details.
Experience. You are passionate about QA and applying testing principles. You have hands-on exposure to manual testing as well as automation. You have direct experience working with data centric applications systems and you are comfortable testing in a Java environment and API testing.
Technical toolkit. You have experience with a range of tools including:
MS SQL Server, SSRS.
TestComplete, Microsoft Test Manager (MTM) and Team Foundation Server (TFS / Azure DevOps).
AWS testing and automation.
An appreciation for cross-team collaboration. You want to be part of a responsive, Agile team and you can adapt to rapidly changing priorities under tight deadlines.
Altus is:
Fast. We are responsive and fast, developing new solutions and features that meet the demands of our users. With the solid financial stability of our bigger parent-group, we can offer the best of both worlds - cool tech, great benefits, challenges and rewards.
First. We continuously innovate to stay ahead of our competitors. We set the standard for the PropTech industry.
Fun. From social Fridays to summer sailing; from holiday parties to mid-winter hackathons, we know how to take a step back and relax with co-workers.
Future-focused. As an organisation, we are focused on growing our reach and our product offering. For anyone joining us, this means the chance to work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients and grow your own career moving up to the next level, choosing to specialise or exploring different product teams.
We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what’s new by following us on LinkedIn .
Come realize your potential at Altus Group!
Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs.

Titre: VIE - ENERGY BUSINESS ANALYST W/M - BELGIUM
Descriptif_du_poste:
Company presentation
World leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 66,000 employees and serves more than 3,6 million customers and patients.
Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.
Air Liquide’s ambition is to lead its industry, deliver long-term performance and contribute to sustainability.

Entity and activity description
Energy supply (power, natural gas notably) is the most important component of the Air Liquide cost of sales and therefore of the competitiveness of Air Liquide products and services.
Société Européenne de Gestion de l’Energie (SEGE) is an AL affiliate providing energy-related expertise and services to all European affiliates (from Portugal to Russia) for the management of their energy sourcing and strategy, including direct sourcing and supply of energy.
SEGE is involved in the next wave of developments within the company strategic program, including digital transformation and commitment to low carbon growth.
SEGE is a multicultural team of 13 persons, organized as a trading desk around 3 “offices”: Front-Office, Back-Office and Middle-Office.
Back- and Middle-Offices are at the core of the energy transaction processes and the ideal position to get a very good understanding of energy management.

Missions and Responsibilities
SEGE Finance Department has launched a transforming project aiming at improving its efficiency. Its ambition is to provide its internal stakeholders with:
enhanced analyses relating to the pursued strategies and their performance,
regulatory watch relating to energy market in Europe,
while ensuring a faultless governance and internal control system.

As an Energy Business Analyst, you will be supporting the Finance team, composed of the Back- and Middle-Offices reporting to the CFO, during this transition period.

You will actively participate to the 4 key processes of the Back-Office :
Confirmation of energy transactions executed by SEGE Front-Office,
Control of supplier invoices and discrepancies management,
Customer billing,
Cash-flow management.
You will also take part to the controlling activities performed by SEGE Middle-Office, including:
Analysis of energy portfolio,
Develop and maintain effective simulation abilities, reporting & indicators to monitor SEGE energy activities and financial risk exposure,
Monitoring of energy-related regulations.
You will as well contribute to monthly financial reporting and to the planning and forecasting processes.

Additionally, as part of the transforming project of the Finance Department, combined with the digital transformation project of SEGE, you will also be involved in the projects aiming at streamlining and optimizing our processes. In particular, you will contribute to the optimization of our tools and processes, leveraging on our recent new billing system and to the forthcoming new data source system.

Competencies and Profile
Ability to analyze and model a business activity.
Organized, and systematic to achieves goals within the timeline.
Commitment to confidentiality and ability to ensure a strong protection of business data and information.
Good verbal and written communication skills
team player,
curious,
rigorous and organized,
ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities,
autonomy in work and proactiveness.

Additional information
The position will be based in Brussels, Belgium for a 12 months period.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements:
https://www.civiweb.com/EN/le-volontariat-international/VIE_CONDITIONS.aspx

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link: https://www.civiweb.com/EN/index.aspx

Anglais courant.
