Vous avez dit Frichti ?
Bien manger pour de bon ! Voilà ce que Frichti garantit aux parisiens depuis 2015 : rendre le bon pratique et abordable.
Dans un environnement de plus en plus contraignant et exigeant, Frichti a des ambitions logistiques très fortes : être capable de livrer le plus vite possible à un coût aussi faible que possible.
Pour créer un modèle logistique efficient et innovant, le défi de Frichti est donc d’intégrer et d’anticiper tous les enjeux de la logistique urbaine, comme par exemple une éventuelle réglementation écologique qui rendraient à terme difficile de circuler à moteur en ville.
L’enjeux de nos ingénieurs est donc multiple:
Résoudre des problématiques complexes telles que l’optimisation des stocks : prévoir le juste volume afin d’assurer disponibilité et de réduire le waste ;
Dimensionner les équipes terrains (préparateurs de commandes et livreurs) pour optimiser le coût de production;
Améliorer de façon continue le modèle de livraison qui permettra de livrer plus vite au coût le plus faible.
Pour y parvenir, Frichti s’appuie donc sur l’intelligence de la data et des modèles de prédictions.
L’équipe Ops aujourd’hui, c’est 3 pôles:
Field Ops, les super héros des centres logistiques
Fleet Ops, les stars de la plateforme de livraison
Food Ops, les défenseurs de notre carte
Une squad tech dédiée

Votre mission si vous l’acceptez :
En tant que Stagiaire Ingénieur amélioration continue: Modèles d'approvisionnement logistiques (H/F), vous reportez directement à notre Food Operations Performance Manager.

Le BIG challenge du pôle Food Ops est de créer une chaîne logistique (de la matière première jusqu'aux hubs logistiques d'où partent les commandes) capable d'assurer la disponibilité de nos produits sur le site à un prix du quotidien. Pour ce faire, Food Ops combine logistique, tech et analyse data pour créer un modèle scalable alliant flexibilité pour s'adapter de manière indépendante à l'évolution des ventes et de l'offre et robustesse en développant des outils performants.
Vous serez en charge de construire et d’améliorer les outils de prédiction de la demande, de pilotage de la production, des approvisionnements ainsi que des flux de stocks des produits.

Ce stage vous correspondra si vous êtes à la recherche d'un stage combinant
un rôle opérationnel fort : sans vous la boutique ne peut pas ouvrir ! Tous les jours vous vous battez pour maintenir les outils, régler les urgences qui permettront de défendre les KPI de votre équipe et de Frichti !
un rôle de gestion de projet - Confronté à un problème, vous déterminez la solution la plus adapté en vous basant sur l'analyse de données avant de préparer un plan et d'organiser son exécution en totale responsabilité. Vous participez à la roadmap Tech en faisant respecter les délais et la scalabilité.


Votre quotidien s'articule entre autre autour des missions suivantes :
La demande de production: construire une demande de production quotidienne pour le laboratoire de production (la cuisine) à partir des prévisions de commandes.
L’analyse de la performance historique: donner de la visibilité et faire des recommandations sur la performance de l’offre aux parties-prenantes (Marketing, R&D, Production, Opérations et Tech).
La création d’outils pour la gestion des aléas et demandes exceptionnelles: les aléas opérationnels (production, livraison) et les demandes exceptionnelles (marketing, opérations) en minimisant leurs impacts en terme de disponibilité et de rebut.
L’amélioration et la formalisation des process: pour assurer leur scalabilité.
Requirements
Votre expérience et vos qualités:
De formation supérieure de type école d'ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire, vous recherchez un stage d'une durée de 6 mois.
Doer : Vous aimez atteindre des résultats et avoir un impact ! Vous souhaitez être pleinement responsable de vos objectifs et projets
Analytique : Utiliser la data pour résoudre des problèmes est un reflexe pour vous !
Thing Big : Vous cherchez des solutions simples à des problèmes complexes ! Rien ne vous fait peur ! Vous souhaitez atteindre de grandes choses !

Travailler chez Frichti c'est :
Participer au développement d’une chaîne logistique écologique, innovante et 100% intégrée !
Construire un modèle logistique permettant de répondre à une offre FRICHTI de plus en plus ambitieuse et donc une chaîne logistique qui se complexifie: plats préparés par nos soins, offres de nos restaurants partenaires, épicerie en ligne, kit recettes!
Répondre à de grosses problématiques de maillage: uniformisation, qualité, dimensionnement... Nous avons plus de 15 centres logistiques à Paris et ce n’est que le début !
S'appuyer sur la data et les modèles de prédictions pour toutes nos décisions stratégiques!
100% d’ownership sur les projets d’entreprise et d’innovation !
Une équipe couteau suisse : optimiser la chaîne logistique de la manière la plus maline possible tel est leur leitmotiv!
Benefits
Les détails pratiques :
Nombre de stages à pourvoir : 3
Type de contrat : Stage ( 6 mois)
Lieu : Paris 3ème
Quand : Novembre 2019
Découvrez les dessous de Frichti et nos actualités les plus croustillantes en suivant notre page LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/frichti/

Titre: Lead Knowledge Analyst - Payments & Transaction Banking
Descriptif_du_poste:
Lead Knowledge Analyst - Payments & Transaction Banking
9149BR
Knowledge & Research
WHAT YOU'LL DO
We are seeking a strong candidate with experience and passion to work in the Payments & Transaction Banking domain. Payments & Transaction Banking is a fast-growing domain within BCG’s Financial Institutions Practice. Topics covered in this domain include Retail Payments (card issuing & acquiring, digital and mobile payments, transaction data & analytics), Transaction Banking (cash management, trade finance), and Payment Infrastructure (clearing houses, payment processing, cryptocurrencies).
YOU'RE GOOD AT
Working closely with consulting and client teams, able to strategically improve our clients performance and effectiveness via subject matter expertise in the broader payments and transaction banking domain
Leveraging our larger data asset products in Transaction Banking (e.g. Global Payment Model, Trade Finance Model, etc.) to deploy them during case engagements, as well as contributing in parts to help develop and refine our methodologies – ability to work with large data sets to conduct analysis is a must
Developing a sharp perspective on a topic by conducting research, leveraging both BCG’s internal assets and 3rd party sources, and communicating those perspectives and insights both verbally and in writing.
Helping the Transaction Banking Leadership Team shape and deliver on the sector's topic strategy, helping drive the commercial agenda for the sector, and being responsible for developing new intellectual property.
Working closely with other KT colleagues from the practice to align on priorities between regions and topics, both within Payments & Transaction Banking as well as across the Financial Institutions Practice (and with affiliated Practices where needed).
Providing customized knowledge for client work, occasionally providing client-facing expertise
Acting as a thought partner, establishing credibility with consulting teams, and providing problem-solving and topic/sector insights
Developing content for go-to-market materials
Advising, sharing knowledge, and training junior Knowledge Team members
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
At least 5+ years of relevant industry experience or 3+ years of consulting firm experience preferably within Payments & Transaction Banking
Advanced university degree and demonstrated high academic achievements
Superior analytical and conceptual skills
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels of seniority
Excellent work management skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks in parallel
Track record of managing and developing people and strong leadership skills
Autonomous self-starter
Ability to tolerate ambiguity
Ability to work well under pressure
Strong service orientation and proactivity
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
YOU'LL WORK WITH
Our knowledge and research specialists collaborate with global colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge and research positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative research careers.
CITY
Paris, Toronto
COUNTRY
Canada, France
YOU'LL BE TRAVELLING
Yes (20%)
YOUR EMPLOYEE TYPE IS
Regular
YOUR JOB TYPE IS
Full time
WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of experts within respective fields or areas providing industry, functional and geographic expertise to consulting teams. KT members are aligned to Practice Areas, sometimes serving as members of case or project teams. KT offers insight into a topic or function derived from BCG’s knowledge base and case/project experience.
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
Toronto location: pending local office hosting approval
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY
The Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws. In addition, as a federal government contractor, BCG maintains an affirmative action program which furthers its commitment and complies with recordkeeping and reporting requirements under certain federal civil rights laws and regulations. BCG is an E-Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

You will join the Product Team and will work in close relationship with the talented IT team. Titre: Alternance - Business Analyst et projets digitaux H/F
Descriptif_du_poste:
Le groupe Total est un acteur majeur de l’énergie, qui produit et commercialise des carburants, du gaz naturel et de l’électricité bas carbone. Nos 100 000 collaborateurs s’engagent pour une énergie meilleure, plus sûre, plus abordable, plus propre et accessible au plus grand nombre. Présent dans 130 pays, notre ambition est de devenir la major de l’énergie responsable.

Au sein de la branche Marketing & Services de Total vous intégrerez le Département Supply International Bitumes en charge de l'approvisionnement de l'ensemble des filiales Total via la négociation (Achat/Vente) de produit et l’affrètement maritime nécessaire à son acheminement.

Structurer les données de l'activité

Accompagner la transformation digital de l'activité :
Développer des dashboard digitaux;
Accompagner le développement d'un outil de market intelligence : Smart Vessel Tracking;
Développer des modules et outils permettant un traitement de certaines phases de l'activité.

Profil recherché
Si vous suivez une formation supérieur en Commerce ou en ingénierie, que vous recherchez une alternance de 1 an dès que possible et que vous :
Justifiez idéalement d’une première expérience dans ce domaine;
Avez une appétence pour la gestion de données digitales et la programmation;
Maitrisez le Pack Office, Power BI et Data Store;
Avez un anglais courant.

Une mission passionnante vous attend au sein de Total. Alors n'attendez plus pour candidater !

The Company
Imerys is a world leader in creating specialty solutions that improve everyday life through minerals. Our success is built on our people, and creating an environment where our 17,800 employees around the globe can thrive.
We passionately believe that our teams are at their best when they have the opportunity to learn, collaborate and find new ways to solve our customers’ challenges, no matter what part of the business they are in.
We can offer you a variety of work and real opportunities to make an impact and be part of our evolution.
If you want to grow your skills and develop your career, find out more at www.imerys.com
The Position
S&OP and Demand Planning Manager
Job Summary
Mission
In the frame of a challenging and international transformation project aimed at bringing benefits to everyone who interacts with the Group, especially for customers with greater focus on sales activities and customer-driven innovation efforts, he/she will work on the implementation of S&OP processes for HTS EMEA Region.
He/she will build and implement a world class Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning process across the enterprise to improve customer satisfaction, profitability, inventory turns and working capital.
He/she will facilitate and drive results in a fast paced environment, leveraging his/her strong interpersonal and leadership skills.
Key leadership position reporting directly to the EMEA Supply Chain Director, this position requires S&OP / SIOP (Sales, Inventory and Operational Planning) background.
Responsibilities
He/she will
Participate in the implementation and leading the execution of the global S&OP processes for HTS EMEA Region.
Execute all facets of the S&OP process to provide an optimum customer service level and working capital performance as defined by the organization’s business operating plans and strategic objectives.
Coordinate demand forecasting process, incorporating business intelligence and forecast information from Segment and finance, for multiple time horizons (rolling 18 month, year end + following calendar year at Budget time) on HTS EMEA
Create and maintain demand forecast models for statistical sales forecasts
Provide demand planning input and forecast to business analyst (for each segment) for review
Ensure data generated by Sales business analyst is suitable for S&OP process. Initiate improvement actions when required.
Write S&OP meeting minutes, communicates key conclusions to stakeholders (sales & finance) and performs follow-up of actions
Define and maintain key S&OP KPIs, incl. S&OP meeting attendance, forecasts accuracy, adherence to S&OP guidance from operations etc.
Lead the HTS EMEA S&OP management reviews incl. run pre-S&OP meetings (demand consensus, supply response, demand/supply reconciliation), prepare all data and metrics for review, identify gaps and scenarios that must be presented, guide final decision making on open items and trade-offs, and prepare escalations for S&OP meetings & executive review where appropriate.
Partner with the marketing and sales of each segment, to ensure the demand consensus process delivers an agreed upon, workable volume forecast (mid and long term); ensure gaps and overlaps are addressed, scenarios are completed and issues appropriately escalated to meet business objectives.
Continuously review the S&OP process to ensure it suits business needs and is up to date with best practices
Key interfaces: strong partnership to be built with (i) Segments leadership, (ii) product management, (iii) Supply Chain, (iii) Operations; (iv) Purchasing; (v) Finance
Participate in monthly best practice sharing meeting with other regions
Drive transformation and implement new BA organization and structure for his/her perimeter
Profile/Competencies
Education, background, level of experience
Qualifications
Master’s degree required with major in a technical field preferred (e.g., industrial engineering, business, etc.);
Minimum 5 years related supply chain management experience including design, implementation and execution of Sales & Operations Planning and related processes (e.g. Demand, Supply, and Material Management) in a multi-site environment
Essential
Demonstrated ability to meet operational goals while also fostering a positive work environment
Strong interpersonal communication, leadership and coaching skills
Analytical and planning skills to establish supply requirements
A track record of implementing and improving performance
Knowledge of ERP systems
Project management
Advocate for data integrity
Strong communication skills and collaborative mind-set
Others: strategic thinking, interpersonal skills, ability to propose solutions
English / French mandatory
German is a plus

Typical profile
S&OP Manager
Senior Demand Planner
Product Manager
Supply Chain Manager
Functional / small BU Controller

Full time
and
Permanent

Job Description

Within the Dailymotion’s AdTech department, we are looking for a new intern to join the Business Operations & Analytics team, in our Paris office. The team’s mission statement is to drive growth, deliver insights & scale efficiency for the AdTech, Sales & Content tribes.
As Business Operations Associate, you will support and actively contribute to the success of the Business Operations & Analytics team thus growing the Dailymotion’s revenue and efficiency.
Your first focus will be on Business Analytics and Revenue Management, growing a full Analyst skillset (both technical and soft skills) before moving to more strategic and operational projects (Sales Operations, Programmatic operations, Supply Operations).
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Revenue Monitoring: develop our monitoring processes and perform frequent business analysis, to make sure we don’t leave any significant fluctuation in our Business Metrics unexplained
Revenue Management: drive cross-functional projects with various AdTech teams, to solve Business and Tech issues and develop revenue-oriented initiatives
Dashboarding: develop our new generation of very high-quality Dashboards, improving access to data and business insights across the whole AdTech organization
Reporting: build, automate and deliver reports to various stakeholders, including our C-level
Business Analysis: perform in-depth analysis of our Business and provide concrete recommendations on how to unlock more revenue
Business Reviews: build from scratch and deliver regular business reviews (Country Business Reviews, Monthly Revenue Meeting, COMEX contributions…)
Business Operations: support our three Business Operations Manager, on various strategic and operational initiatives on SalesOps, Programmatic Ops and Supply Ops
Data: support our Data improvement initiatives, interfacing between new Data needs and the Data Engineers
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU
Join Dailymotion at a key period of growth and development, with multiple key projects being launched from the ground-up to achieve very ambitious goals over the next few years
Join a growing team with many processes to improve and projects to implement, with the opportunity to play a key role and bring new ideas to the table
Learn to set and maintain very high standards and great attention to details, developing the full consultant skill set
Develop key hard skills, including:
Data collection skills and SQL
Data visualization skills (PPT, Tableau Dashboard)
Analysis skills to deep dive into the data and transform it into Business Insights
A variety of Analytics tools such as: Thinkcell, PowerQuery, Excel…
A variety of internal tools such as: JIRA, Salesforce…
Develop key soft skills, including:
Organization skills working on multiple demands in parallel
Maintaining very high standards for deliverables and great attention to detail
Synthesis and written and oral communication skills (C-level, managers)
All in all, gain a great understanding of the key business factors of successes of a large, international tech company

Qualifications

Ongoing or obtained Master’s degree from a Top Business or Engineering School
Great rigor, structured approach to problem solving and very strong attention to detail
Creative and entrepreneurial mindset, highly autonomous and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Amazing ability to synthesize complex subjects into a couple of key comprehensive messages
Highly proficient on Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Knowledge and great motivation for the Digital / Technology / AdTech industries
Previous experience with SQL and Tableau is a big plus
Previous experience is valued (previous internship in a consulting firm, an investment bank or in a tech company)
Fluent English (written and oral)

Additional Information

6 months internship
If you want to explore Dailymotion culture a little further, please check out:
Our BuiltIn page: https://www.builtinnyc.com/company/dailymotion
Our Recent Global Hackathon: https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x70val9
Welcome to the Jungle page: https://www.welcometothejungle.co/companies/dailymotion/team
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Who we are
At Criteo, we are building the advertising platform of choice for the open Internet, an ecosystem that favors neutrality, transparency and inclusiveness. With more than 1.4 billion active shoppers and $600 billion in annual commerce sales, we deliver performance at scale. Founded in a Paris start-up incubator, Criteo now carries out our entrepreneurial spirit across 30+ global offices. Do you want to have an impact on more than half of the world’s internet users? Join us and be part of something big.

We are looking for a researcher with expert-level understanding and experience with primary and secondary research and analytics for a global organization, including (but not limited to) customer experience measurement. This role requires the ability to integrate data from multiple sources to form cohesive and innovative insights.

The position will help to shape and support the growth of the corporate marketing team, field marketing teams, and the organization at large. This role requires a passion for data-driven storytelling, a desire to constantly expand and transform the Criteo story, the skillful ability to work with several different departments – many of which have different goals and timelines, and extensive experience with survey programming and survey methodology.
They must be creative, able to constantly uncover new and interesting angles, all while managing expectations and deliverables. This is a fast-paced team so agility and a positive attitude are key to success.

This position is a 6 months fixed term contract from september to end of february.
What you will do
Lead primary (and sometimes secondary) market research efforts and data analysis to drive and support the marketing insights team strategy
Provide evidence-based strategic insights with a futuristic viewpoint identifying potential opportunities
Leverage insights to support company initiatives, product launches, sales strategies, and corporate marketing campaigns
Collaborate with key stakeholders and various team in the development and use of market insights including the content team, field marketing teams, product marketing, sales, and analytics teams
Collect data, interpret/analyze results and present conclusions in a variety of formats including research reports, whitepapers, high-profile keynotes, blog posts, press releases and more, for a number of regions/languages
Evaluate research tools and emerging technology
Work diligently and efficiently to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Deliver projects in-time and on-budget.
Ensure adherence to professional standards and ethics of research.
Who You Are
Experience in marketing research and data analysis. Experience with market research vendor preferred.
Degree in a related field of study (e.g., Statistics, Market Research, Psychology, Sociology)
Strong experience working with web-based tools for survey research, analysis and reporting (we use Qualtrics)
Proficiency with Tableau and Wrike a plus (if not, then we'll ask you to learn how to use these tools)
Demonstrated record of initiative, problem solving, and adaptabilityStrong listening, communication, and collaboration skills
Team player who enjoys collaborating with a high performing group
You must have a portfolio of creative samples showing a range of work
At Criteo, we dare to be different. We believe that diversity fuels innovation and creates an energy that can be seen and felt all over Criteo. We champion different perspectives and are committed to creating a workplace where all Criteos are heard and feel a sense of belonging.
